edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.commitmentScheme.simpleHash

Class CmtSimpleHashCommitter

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.commitmentScheme.simpleHash.CmtSimpleHashCommitter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CmtCommitter, CommitSecLevel, SecureCommit, SecurityLevel

    public class CmtSimpleHashCommitter
extends java.lang.Object
implements CmtCommitter, SecureCommit
    This class implements the committer side of Simple Hash commitment.

    This is a commitment scheme based on hash functions.

    It can be viewed as a random-oracle scheme, but its security can also be viewed as a standard assumption on modern hash functions. Note that computational binding follows from the standard collision resistance assumption.

    The pseudo code of this protocol can be found in Protocol 3.6 of pseudo codes document at http://crypto.biu.ac.il/scapi/SDK_Pseudocode_SCAPI_V2.0.0.pdf.

    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Yael Ejgenberg)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void commit(CmtCommitValue input, long id)
      Runs the commit phase of the commitment scheme: "SAMPLE a random value r <- {0, 1}^n COMPUTE c = H(r,x) (c concatenated with r) SEND c to R".
      void decommit(long id)
      Runs the decommit phase of the commitment scheme: "SEND (r, x) to R OUTPUT nothing."
      byte[] generateBytesFromCommitValue(CmtCommitValue value)
      This function converts the given commit value to a byte array.
      CmtCCommitmentMsg generateCommitmentMsg(CmtCommitValue input, long id)
      Runs the following lines of the commitment scheme: "SAMPLE a random value r <- {0, 1}^n COMPUTE c = H(r,x) (c concatenated with r)".
      CmtCommitValue generateCommitValue(byte[] x)
      This function wraps the raw data x with a suitable CommitValue instance according to the actual implementaion.
      CmtCDecommitmentMessage generateDecommitmentMsg(long id)
      Generate a decommitment message using the given id.
      CmtCommitmentPhaseValues getCommitmentPhaseValues(long id)
      This function returns the values calculated during the commit phase for a specific commitment.
      java.lang.Object[] getPreProcessValues()
      No pre-process is performed for Simple Hash Committer, therefore this function returns null!
      CmtCommitValue sampleRandomCommitValue()
      This function samples random commit value and returns it.

      • generateDecommitmentMsg

        public CmtCDecommitmentMessage generateDecommitmentMsg(long id)
        Description copied from interface: CmtCommitter
        Generate a decommitment message using the given id.

        There are cases when the user wants to decommit but remain non-interactive, meaning not to send the generate message yet. The reasons for doing that are vary, for example the user wants to prepare a lot of decommitments and send together. In these cases the decommit function is not useful since it sends the generates decommit message to the other party.

        This function generates the message without sending it and this allows the user to save it and send it later if he wants.

        In case the decommit phase is interactive, the decommit message cannot be generated and an IllegalStateException will be thrown. In this case one should use the decommit function instead. Code example: giving a committer object and an input, //Create three commitment messages. CmtCDecommitmentMessage msg1 = generateDecommitmentMsg(1); CmtCDecommitmentMessage msg2 = generateDecommitmentMsg(2); CmtCDecommitmentMessage msg3 = generateDecommitmentMsg(3); ... try { //Send the messages by the channel. channel.send(msg1); channel.send(msg2); channel.send(msg3); } catch (IOException e) { throw new IOException("failed to send the decommitment. The error is: " + e.getMessage()); }

        Specified by:
        generateDecommitmentMsg in interface CmtCommitter
        Parameters:
        id - Unique value attached to the input to keep track of the commitments in the case that many commitments are performed one after the other without decommiting them yet.
        Returns:
        the generated decommitment object.

      • getPreProcessValues

        public java.lang.Object[] getPreProcessValues()

      • getCommitmentPhaseValues

        public CmtCommitmentPhaseValues getCommitmentPhaseValues(long id)
        Description copied from interface: CmtCommitter
        This function returns the values calculated during the commit phase for a specific commitment.

        This function is used for protocols that need values of the commitment, like ZK protocols during proofs on the commitment. We recommended not to call this function from somewhere else.

        Specified by:
        getCommitmentPhaseValues in interface CmtCommitter
        Parameters:
        id - of the specific commitment
        Returns:
        values calculated during the commit phase
